intro: Dillwynia myrtifolia, commonly known as the mountain dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often compound leaves. The plant features delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically pale yellow to white, arranged in racemes. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
